content:
Hi all! Someone have implemented picture galleries managed by "Editor" on multi-language site, e.g. translatable galleries?
Seems like management via Views is too complicated for our target audience.
Any advice very welcome.
Hi @Vladimir - what has to be translatable? Can you describe your setup a bit? How did you try it with views?

Two or more languages on site, each gallery item is translatable node which need to be present in the gallery(es) (translatable as well). I do not try to do something with views because building such galleries should be done by content editor.
So gallery is any kind of lists of nodes opening by click on list item. Taxonomy pages (terms) are not translatable yet too.
Seems like we haven't working solution for such complicated thing.

I'm not sure about translation yet, but generally I build a gallery not from multiple nodes but from multiple images within one node (uploading images easily with HTML5 upload). That makes building a gallery less complicated.
Thank you @Olaf Grabienski , I know such solution. In my case, any picture is an art installation, which requires its own descriptive page.
Terms as galleries seems like it would work once i18n is fully tested/released.

@Laryn thanks, it was first thing I've tried. Terms on current stage not translatable at all. Seems like access permissions issue - even URL of type taxonomy/term/TID/translate return "Access denied" error. I haven't opportunity dive into module code yet.
There is already basic translation of terms in Backdrop core. Is that too limited?
@Herb thanks, how it works?

Sorry, my bad: found it via #2934

Translate taxonomy terms 路 Issue #2934 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Describe your issue or idea Like @quicksketch's pared down approach for menu items #225 perhaps we can approach taxonomy terms the same way. This would mean terms have a language but we leave t...
You can set a language per term in core. But core doesn't have translation sets for terms, if you need that. I can't recall, but you might also have locale for terms
To have translation sets of terms, i18n in the only option. i18n_taxonomy submodule ships with that functionality.
Thanks all, unfortunately as I mentioned before in this thread (maybe not so clear) i18n_taxonomy don't work for me. Temporarily I forced to use some workaround without using taxonomy and i18n.
@Vladimir Whatever works for you :slight_smile:
